description: Refurbishment and improvement works to interior and exterior of property to include removal of modern cladding panels in order to repair and refurbish existing timber structural framework and other associated internal and external repairs

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: KEYACO Kingston Old Town Conservation Area
KEYACH Kingston Town Centre Key Area of Change
CONARA Kingston Old Town Conservation Area

decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent. Reason: As required by Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

Prior to commencement details and method statement(s) shall be submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority of any required splicing with appropriate new timber, employing 'scarf' joints. A detailed survey drawing recording the timber elements, their condition and significance and any required repairs will also be submitted to the local planning authority for approval which records any loss or alteration of fabric.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Prior to commencement of the hereby approved works, the applicant shall submit a written and photographic document of all of the existing infill panel materials, so issues and impacts of proposals can be accurately understood. The document shall also detail the staged process of the removal of any historic fabric in conjunction with the proposed repairs. The approved works shall be implemented in accordance with the approved written and photographic document and staged plan of works.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any proposed repairs to sole plates must use air-dried timber, on a bed of lime mortar atop a brick plinth if required. Further information on the proposed repairs, including a detailed method statement for the repair or replacement of the soleplate shall be submitted to the local planning authority for approval prior to commencement of works.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the works permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In order that the special architectural and historic character of the Listed Building is safeguarded in accordance with Policies CS8 (Character, Heritage and Design), DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) and DM12 (Development in Conservation Areas and Affecting Heritage Assets) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
